alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 25 at 9:34PM MDT until April 26 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches above 7,500 feet near the Colorado border with locally up to 10 inches over mountain peaks. Meanwhile, 1 to 3 inches are expected below 7,500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will reduce visibilities to under one mile at times. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 3 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of Interstate 25 around Raton Pass. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
